Literature Review: The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in computational pathology of cancer has revolutionized the field of histopathology, enabling the automation of repetitive tasks and the improvement of diagnostic workflows. Recent studies have demonstrated the potential of AI methods in predicting genetic alterations, identifying prognostic and predictive biomarkers, and enhancing clinical outcomes. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of AI in cancer histopathology, highlighting the latest tools and techniques that hold promise for improving treatment decisions.
